newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - AmSouth raised to buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - AmSouth raised to buy.

text.p: -- Interstate/Johnson Lane said on Friday analysts John Mason, Marguerite Sons and J. Dillon Bowles had raised their rating for AmSouth Bancorp to buy from neutral.
-- "AmSouth is currently selling at attractive valuation levels on a price-to-earnings and price-to-book basis," they wrote in a report.
-- They set a 12-month price target of $62 a share.
-- Their 1997 earnings-per-share (EPS) estimate remained at $3.95. The analysts set a 1998 EPS estimate of $4.40.
-- Shares in the Birmingham, Ala., company closed on Thursday at 51-7/8.
